After almost 2 months of heavy porting, Snowstorm Entertainment is proud
to announce the release of Openglad 0.9. 0.9 is a
very-close-to-fully-featured port, lacking only 2 minor features from the
latest version of Gladiator, and including some added features.

First, some terminology:

- Openglad: this is what the port of Gladiator is called. Tom suggested it
a long time ago and the name stuck. We've been using it to distinguish
between Gladiator the original and the port, and we've gotten used to it.
- Openscen: port of the scenario editor

Important notes:

- the binary tarball contains Linux binaries only. We havn't gotten it to
compile under anything but Linux (only tried Linux and Windows), and its
not on our todo list yet, but if you manage to get the source compiling
under any other platform, let us know how you did it and we'll include it
in future releases.

Lacking features:

- Scrolling by moving the mouse to the edge of the screen in openscen
(this was generating immense amounts of bugs so we replaced it with other
ways to scroll)
- fade in/out (minor feature, but worth mentioning. we'll implement it
soon)

Added features:

- Multiple joystick support: you can now have every player playing on a
joystick
- Minimap-scrolling: you can now more around in openscen by clicking on
the minimap
- Key scrolling: you can now scroll in openscen using the keypad

Credits:

- FSGames deserves 99.9% of the credit for writing the original game
and open sourcing it. Snowstorm is forever thankful to them.
- Zardus and Sean did all of the porting
- dph_of_rules deserves a special thanks for creating his scenario pack,
which we used to stress test the game and catch some bugs and
slowdowns (especially his scenario 150).

Known Bugs:

- Phantom mode (cleric's mystic mace, mage's energy wave, anything that
warps the ground underneath) is still slow if there's too many of those
types of objects on the screen. It's ok normally, but if you're in dph's
scenario 150, it gets slow on my Athlon 750

Where to get it:

http://snowstorm.sourceforge.net - Snowstorm's site. You can download it
from there
http://sourceforge.net/projects/snowstorm - you can download it from the
sourceforge project page as well


Have fun!

- Zardus
